docs.snippet: In a story Feb. 1 about how President Donald Trump's immigration restrictions could affect tourism and higher education, The Associated Press incorrectly reported that an education group called Open Doors had calculated that foreign students suppo...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Feb. 1 about how President Donald Trump's immigration restrictions could affect tourism and higher education, The Associated Press incorrectly reported that an education group called Open Doors had calculated that foreign students supported 400,000 jobs in the 2015-2016 academic year. In fact, that figure was calculated by NAFSA: Association of International Educators.
